item.title: Comment on What are your favorite non-violent movies? by Marc
item.description:
When my son was rather young (middle school?) and becoming too enamored with (a) entertainment violence, (b) glorified violence AND my wife was out of town for several days...we watched Full Metal Jacket, Hamburger Hill, Platoon, Deer Hunter and Born on the Fourth of July over one weekend...with only a comedic break for Good Morning Vietnam.

As a small sample empirical exercise, that made him non-violent quite efficiently!

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/05/what-are-your-favorite-non-violent-movies.html?commentID=160760209

item.title: Comment on What are your favorite non-violent movies? by ricardo

item.title: Comment on What are your favorite non-violent movies? by Vulcidian
item.description:
1. I finally watched War Horse (2011). It's one of the best big screen depictions of violence in the service of a message of non-violence that I can recall seeing in a while.

2. Pokemon the First Movie (1998) was and remains a great movie for kids and adults with a non-violent message.

3. Deep Space 9 Episode 119 "Duet". Not exactly a movie, but definitely one of the best Episodes in all Star Trek with a strong non-violent message.

4. Selma (2014). Given how movements for equal rights have gone in other countries I still think we take the protest leaders of the 60s for granted a bit. Granted if they had been more violent they probably would have been less successful, but as we've seen in the Middle East its very possible for uncompromising leaders with a death wish to march their followers to ruin and still claim the moral high ground.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/05/what-are-your-favorite-non-violent-movies.html?commentID=160760056
